findings.issue: Performance requirements reference ASCE/SEI 7 without specifying the edition. For California K-12 projects under DSA jurisdiction, CBC 2022 adopts ASCE 7-22. The specification should explicitly reference ASCE 7-22 to ensure compliance with current seismic design requirements.
findings.existingText: Structural Performance:  Hangers and supports for HVAC piping and equipment shall withstand the effects of gravity loads and stresses within limits and under conditions indicated according to ASCE/SEI 7.
findings.replacementText: Structural Performance:  Hangers and supports for HVAC piping and equipment shall withstand the effects of gravity loads and stresses within limits and under conditions indicated according to ASCE/SEI 7-22 as adopted by CBC 2022.

findings.issue: The specification mentions 'Design seismic-restraint hangers and supports for piping and equipment' but does not reference DSA-specific seismic requirements including DSA IR A-6 for seismic certification or OSHPD pre-approval (OPA) requirements. For K-12 projects under DSA jurisdiction, seismic restraint design must comply with DSA interpretations.
findings.replacementText: Seismic restraint design shall comply with DSA IR A-6. Provide seismic certification documentation and OSHPD pre-approval (OPA) where applicable for all seismic restraint components.

findings.issue: Shop Drawings submittal requirements do not include seismic calculations or DSA-required certifications. For DSA projects, submittals for seismic restraints must include engineering calculations sealed by a California-licensed professional engineer and compliance documentation per DSA requirements.
findings.existingText: Shop Drawings:  Signed and sealed by a qualified professional engineer. Show fabrication and installation details and include calculations for the following; include Product Data for components:
findings.replacementText: Shop Drawings:  Signed and sealed by a professional engineer licensed in the State of California. Show fabrication and installation details and include calculations for the following; include Product Data for components. Include seismic restraint calculations demonstrating compliance with ASCE 7-22 and CBC 2022. Include DSA IR A-6 compliance documentation and OSHPD OPA certificates where applicable:

findings.issue: MSS SP-58 reference does not include edition year. Current edition is MSS SP-58-2018. Specifying the edition ensures clarity and compliance verification.
findings.existingText: Description:  MSS SP-58, Types 1 through 58, factory-fabricated components.
findings.replacementText: Description:  MSS SP-58-2018, Types 1 through 58, factory-fabricated components.

findings.issue: MFMA-4 standard reference lacks edition year. This applies throughout the Metal Framing Systems article. Current edition should be specified for clarity.
findings.existingText: Standard:  MFMA-4.
findings.replacementText: Standard:  MFMA-4, current edition.

findings.issue: High-Type Single-Pipe Stand specifies cadmium-plated steel components. Cadmium plating is restricted under California Proposition 65 and various environmental regulations due to toxicity. Consider specifying zinc-plated or stainless steel alternatives.
findings.existingText:
Vertical Members:  Two or more cadmium-plated-steel or stainless-steel, continuous-thread rods.
Horizontal Member:  Cadmium-plated-steel or stainless-steel rod with plastic or stainless-steel, roller-type pipe support.
findings.replacementText:
Vertical Members:  Two or more hot-dip galvanized steel or stainless-steel, continuous-thread rods.
Horizontal Member:  Hot-dip galvanized steel or stainless-steel rod with plastic or stainless-steel, roller-type pipe support.

findings.issue: Grout specification references ASTM C 1107 without edition year. Current edition is ASTM C1107-21. Edition year should be specified.
findings.existingText: Grout:  ASTM C 1107, factory-mixed and -packaged, dry, hydraulic-cement, nonshrink and nonmetallic grout
findings.replacementText: Grout:  ASTM C1107-21, factory-mixed and -packaged, dry, hydraulic-cement, nonshrink and nonmetallic grout

findings.issue: MSS SP-69 and MSS SP-89 references lack edition years. This applies throughout Part 3. Current editions should be specified for clarity and verification.
findings.existingText: Metal Pipe-Hanger Installation:  Comply with MSS SP-69 and MSS SP-89.
findings.replacementText: Metal Pipe-Hanger Installation:  Comply with MSS SP-69-2020 and MSS SP-89-2021.

findings.issue: Structural steel reference ASTM A 36/A 36M uses outdated designation format. Current designation is ASTM A36/A36M with no spaces.
findings.existingText: Structural Steel:  ASTM A 36/A 36M, carbon-steel plates, shapes, and bars; black and galvanized.
findings.replacementText: Structural Steel:  ASTM A36/A36M, carbon-steel plates, shapes, and bars; black and galvanized.

findings.issue: ASME B31.9 is referenced for pipe stress limits and deflections, but this standard is for building services piping and may not cover all HVAC piping applications. For hydronic systems, ASME B31.9 is appropriate, but refrigerant piping should reference ASME B31.5. The specification should clarify applicability.
findings.existingText: Do not exceed pipe stress limits allowed by ASME B31.9 for building services piping.
findings.replacementText: Do not exceed pipe stress limits allowed by ASME B31.9 for hydronic and building services piping, or ASME B31.5 for refrigerant piping.

findings.issue: Reference to AWS D1.1/D1.1M lacks edition year. Current edition is AWS D1.1/D1.1M:2020. Applies throughout this section.
findings.existingText: Field Welding:  Comply with AWS D1.1/D1.1M procedures
findings.replacementText: Field Welding:  Comply with AWS D1.1/D1.1M:2020 procedures

findings.issue: SSPC-PA 1 reference lacks edition year. Current edition is SSPC-PA 1-2016. Should specify edition for verification.
findings.existingText: Comply with SSPC-PA 1 requirements for touching up field-painted surfaces.
findings.replacementText: Comply with SSPC-PA 1-2016 requirements for touching up field-painted surfaces.

findings.issue: ASTM A 780 reference uses outdated designation format with spaces. Current designation is ASTM A780/A780M.
findings.existingText: apply galvanizing-repair paint to comply with ASTM A 780.
findings.replacementText: apply galvanizing-repair paint to comply with ASTM A780/A780M.

findings.issue: MFMA-103 reference lacks edition year and verification of current applicability for metal framing systems.
findings.existingText: Comply with MFMA-103 for metal framing system selections and applications that are not specified in piping system Sections.
findings.replacementText: Comply with MFMA-103, current edition, for metal framing system selections and applications that are not specified in piping system Sections.

findings.issue: Orphaned editing note 'Retain definitions remaining after this Section has been edited' should be removed from final specification.
findings.existingText: Retain definitions remaining after this Section has been edited.

findings.issue: Orphaned editing note regarding copper pipe hanger sizes should be removed from final specification.
findings.existingText: Manufacturers' catalogs indicate that copper pipe hangers are small, typically NPS 4 (DN 100) or smaller, and types available are limited.

findings.fileName: 230553 - IDENTIFICATION FOR HVAC PIPING AND EQUIPMENT.docx
findings.issue: Pipe label lettering size minimum is specified as '1-1/2 incheshigh' with missing space between 'inches' and 'high'.
findings.existingText: Lettering Size:  At least 1-1/2 incheshigh.
findings.replacementText: Lettering Size:  At least 1-1/2 inches high.

findings.fileName: 230553 - IDENTIFICATION FOR HVAC PIPING AND EQUIPMENT.docx
findings.issue: Pipe label color schedule for chilled-water piping lists two 'Letter Color' options (White and Black) which appears to be an editing error. Only one letter color should be specified.
findings.existingText:
Letter Color:  White.
Letter Color:  Black.
findings.replacementText: Letter Color:  White.

findings.fileName: 230553 - IDENTIFICATION FOR HVAC PIPING AND EQUIPMENT.docx
findings.issue: Multiple orphaned editing notes remain in the specification (e.g., 'In first paragraph below, describe required label content', 'Retain requirement in Action Submittals Article'). These should be removed from final specification.
findings.existingText: In first paragraph below, describe required label content...

findings.fileName: 230553 - IDENTIFICATION FOR HVAC PIPING AND EQUIPMENT.docx
findings.issue: Multiple orphaned editing notes in valve-tag application schedule (e.g., 'Revise this article as required', 'Select contrasting valve-tag color'). These should be removed from final specification.
findings.existingText: Revise this article as required to delete an entire piping system from tagging or other changes...

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: TAB contractor qualification requires only AABC certification. For California K-12 DSA projects, TAB contractors should also be required to have experience with DSA projects and familiarity with DSA commissioning requirements. Additionally, NEBB certification should be listed as an acceptable alternative to AABC.
findings.existingText: TAB Contractor Qualifications:  Engage a TAB entity certified by AABC.
findings.replacementText: TAB Contractor Qualifications:  Engage a TAB entity certified by AABC or NEBB. TAB contractor shall have documented experience with California DSA projects within the past five years.

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: ASHRAE/IESNA 90.1 reference is outdated. The standard is now published as ASHRAE 90.1 (IESNA is no longer part of the title). California Energy Code (Title 24 Part 6) should be referenced for California projects as it takes precedence over ASHRAE 90.1.
findings.existingText: ASHRAE/IESNA Compliance:  Applicable requirements in ASHRAE/IESNA 90.1, Section 6.7.2.3 - "System Balancing."
findings.replacementText: Energy Code Compliance:  Applicable requirements in California Energy Code (Title 24 Part 6) and ASHRAE 90.1, Section 6.7.2.3 - "System Balancing."
findings.codeReference: California Energy Code Title 24 Part 6, ASHRAE 90.1

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: ASHRAE 62.1 reference lacks edition year. Current edition is ASHRAE 62.1-2022. For California projects, Title 24 ventilation requirements should also be referenced.
findings.existingText: Comply with requirements in ASHRAE 62.1, Section 7.2.2 - "Air Balancing."
findings.replacementText: Comply with requirements in ASHRAE 62.1-2022, Section 7.2.2 - "Air Balancing" and California Title 24 Part 4 (CMC) ventilation requirements.

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: ASHRAE 111 reference lacks edition year. Current edition is ASHRAE 111-2008 (RA 2017). Edition should be specified.
findings.existingText: Instrumentation Type, Quantity, Accuracy, and Calibration:  As described in ASHRAE 111, Section 5, "Instrumentation."
findings.replacementText: Instrumentation Type, Quantity, Accuracy, and Calibration:  As described in ASHRAE 111-2008 (RA 2017), Section 5, "Instrumentation."

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: Orphaned editing note 'Retain definition(s) remaining after this Section has been edited' should be removed from final specification.
findings.existingText: Retain definition(s) remaining after this Section has been edited.

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: Multiple bracketed options remain unresolved throughout the specification (e.g., '[Architect] [Owner] [Construction Manager] [Commissioning Authority]'). While noted as handled separately, these instances appear throughout and should be resolved to a single entity.
findings.existingText: [Architect] [Owner] [Construction Manager] [Commissioning Authority]
findings.replacementText: Architect

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: Reference to SMACNA's 'HVAC Systems - Duct Design' and AMCA 201 lack edition years. Current editions should be specified.
findings.existingText: To calculate system effects for air systems, use tables and charts found in AMCA 201, "Fans and Systems," or in SMACNA's "HVAC Systems - Duct Design."
findings.replacementText: To calculate system effects for air systems, use tables and charts found in AMCA 201-02 (R2011), "Fans and Systems," or in SMACNA's "HVAC Systems - Duct Design," 4th Edition.

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: Tolerances for air and water flow rates are specified at plus or minus 10 percent. For California Energy Code compliance and proper system performance, tighter tolerances may be required for certain applications, particularly for ventilation air quantities per ASHRAE 62.1.
findings.replacementText: Outdoor Air Ventilation Rates: Plus 10 percent, minus 0 percent of design values to ensure minimum ventilation requirements per ASHRAE 62.1 and Title 24 are maintained.

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: Orphaned editing note 'Revise contents of reports specified in this article to suit office practice' should be removed from final specification.
findings.existingText: Revise contents of reports specified in this article to suit office practice.

findings.issue: ASTM C 553 reference uses outdated designation format with space. Current designation is ASTM C553. Additionally, edition year should be specified.
findings.existingText: Comply with ASTM C 553, Type II and ASTM C 1290, Type III with factory-applied FSK jacket.
findings.replacementText: Comply with ASTM C553, Type II and ASTM C1290, Type III with factory-applied FSK jacket.

findings.issue: ASTM C 612 reference uses outdated designation format with space. Current designation is ASTM C612. This applies throughout the section.
findings.existingText: Comply with ASTM C 612, Type IA or Type IB.
findings.replacementText: Comply with ASTM C612, Type IA or Type IB.

findings.issue: ASTM C 1393 reference uses outdated designation format. Current designation is ASTM C1393. This applies throughout the section.
findings.existingText: complying with ASTM C 1393, Type II or Type IIIA Category 2
findings.replacementText: complying with ASTM C1393, Type II or Type IIIA Category 2

findings.issue: Surface-burning characteristics reference ASTM E 84 without edition year. Current edition is ASTM E84. Format uses outdated designation with space.
findings.existingText: as determined by testing identical products according to ASTM E 84
findings.replacementText: as determined by testing identical products according to ASTM E84

findings.issue: Multiple orphaned editing notes remain throughout Part 2 (e.g., 'Retain ASTM C 1290 types as follows', 'For operating temperatures higher than 250 deg F'). These should be removed from final specification.
findings.existingText: Retain ASTM C 1290 types as follows:  Type I for insulation without jackets...

findings.issue: Military Specification MIL-A-3316C referenced was last updated in 1987 and is outdated. Consider referencing more current industry standards or manufacturer requirements.
findings.existingText: Materials shall be compatible with insulation materials, jackets, and substrates and for bonding insulation to itself and to surfaces to be insulated unless otherwise indicated.
findings.replacementText: Materials shall be compatible with insulation materials, jackets, and substrates and for bonding insulation to itself and to surfaces to be insulated unless otherwise indicated. Adhesives shall comply with applicable ASTM standards and manufacturer's recommendations.

findings.issue: MIL-PRF-19565C reference for mastics may be outdated. Current industry practice often references manufacturer specifications and ASTM standards for mastic performance.
findings.existingText: Materials shall be compatible with insulation materials, jackets, and substrates; comply with MIL-PRF-19565C, Type II.
findings.replacementText: Materials shall be compatible with insulation materials, jackets, and substrates; comply with MIL-PRF-19565C, Type II or equivalent ASTM standard.

findings.issue: Fire-rated wall penetration installation references Section 078413 with a typo ('irestopping' instead of 'Firestopping'). This could cause confusion during construction.
findings.existingText: Comply with requirements in Section 078413 "Penetration Firestopping"irestopping and fire-resistive joint sealers.
findings.replacementText: Comply with requirements in Section 078413 "Penetration Firestopping" for firestopping and fire-resistive joint sealers.

findings.issue: Fire-rated insulation systems reference NRTL (Nationally Recognized Testing Laboratory) but do not specify that the fire rating must be established by a DSA-accepted testing agency or comply with CBC requirements for K-12 facilities.
findings.existingText: Tested and certified to provide a [1] [2]-hour fire rating by an NRTL acceptable to authorities having jurisdiction.
findings.replacementText: Tested and certified to provide a 2-hour fire rating by an NRTL acceptable to DSA and authorities having jurisdiction, in accordance with CBC Chapter 7.

findings.issue: Indoor duct insulation schedule specifies 1-1/2 inch insulation thickness for supply, return, and outdoor air ducts. California Energy Code (Title 24 Part 6) may require different R-values based on climate zone. Specification should reference Title 24 requirements or verify compliance.
findings.replacementText: Insulation thickness and R-values shall comply with California Energy Code Title 24 Part 6 requirements for the applicable climate zone. Thicknesses indicated are minimums; increase as required for code compliance.

findings.issue: Indoor piping insulation schedule specifies 1-inch thick mineral fiber for chilled water and 2-inch thick for heating hot water. These thicknesses should be verified against California Energy Code Title 24 Part 6 Table 120.3-A minimum pipe insulation requirements, which vary by pipe size and fluid temperature.
findings.replacementText: Insulation thickness shall comply with California Energy Code Title 24 Part 6 Table 120.3-A minimum requirements. Where specified thicknesses exceed code minimums, use specified thickness. Where code requires greater thickness than specified, comply with code requirements.
findings.codeReference: California Energy Code Title 24 Part 6, Table 120.3-A

findings.issue: ASTM C 534 reference uses outdated designation format with space. Current designation is ASTM C534. This format issue applies throughout the section for multiple ASTM references.
findings.existingText: Comply with ASTM C 534, Type I for tubular materials.
findings.replacementText: Comply with ASTM C534, Type I for tubular materials.

findings.issue: ASTM C 547 reference uses outdated designation format. Current designation is ASTM C547.
findings.existingText: Comply with ASTM C 547, Type I, Grade A, with factory-applied ASJ.
findings.replacementText: Comply with ASTM C547, Type I, Grade A, with factory-applied ASJ.

findings.issue: ASTM C 195 reference for mineral-fiber insulating cement uses outdated designation format and lacks edition year.
findings.existingText: Mineral-Fiber Insulating Cement:  Comply with ASTM C 195.
findings.replacementText: Mineral-Fiber Insulating Cement:  Comply with ASTM C195.

findings.issue: Multiple orphaned editing notes remain throughout Part 2 (e.g., 'Military Specification in this article was the only standard available', 'Product attributes in first paragraph below are based on'). These should be removed from final specification.
findings.existingText: Military Specification in this article was the only standard available when this Section was written...

findings.issue: Products that contact stainless steel reference ASTM C 871 for chloride content testing using outdated format. Also references ASTM C 795 for austenitic stainless steel qualification. Both use outdated ASTM format.
findings.existingText:
Products that come in contact with stainless steel shall have a leachable chloride content of less than 50 ppm when tested according to ASTM C 871.
Insulation materials for use on austenitic stainless steel shall be qualified as acceptable according to ASTM C 795.
findings.replacementText:
Products that come in contact with stainless steel shall have a leachable chloride content of less than 50 ppm when tested according to ASTM C871.
Insulation materials for use on austenitic stainless steel shall be qualified as acceptable according to ASTM C795.

findings.issue: ASTM B 209 reference for aluminum jacket uses outdated format. Current designation is ASTM B209.
findings.existingText: Aluminum Jacket:  Comply with ASTM B 209, Alloy 3003, 3005, 3105, or 5005, Temper H-14.
findings.replacementText: Aluminum Jacket:  Comply with ASTM B209, Alloy 3003, 3005, 3105, or 5005, Temper H-14.

findings.issue: ASTM C 1136 reference for tape compliance uses outdated format. Current designation is ASTM C1136.
findings.existingText: complying with ASTM C 1136.
findings.replacementText: complying with ASTM C1136.

findings.issue: Heating hot water insulation thickness is specified as 2 inches for all pipe sizes. California Energy Code Title 24 Part 6 Table 120.3-A requires varying insulation thickness based on pipe size and operating temperature. For hot water systems above 200°F, larger pipes may require greater insulation thickness.
findings.existingText: Mineral-Fiber, Preformed Pipe, Type I: 2 inches thick.
findings.replacementText: Mineral-Fiber, Preformed Pipe, Type I: 2 inches thick minimum; increase thickness as required to comply with California Energy Code Title 24 Part 6 Table 120.3-A for pipe size and operating temperature.
findings.codeReference: California Energy Code Title 24 Part 6, Table 120.3-A

findings.issue: The Hanger and Support Schedule in Part 3 is excessively detailed with 58+ MSS types listed. Most projects use only a handful of hanger types. This level of detail creates unnecessary specification bulk and increases the chance of errors. Consider simplifying to commonly used types and allowing contractor flexibility for equivalent hangers.
findings.existingText: Horizontal-Piping Hangers and Supports:  Unless otherwise indicated and except as specified in piping system Sections, install the following types: [lengthy list follows]...
findings.replacementText: Horizontal-Piping Hangers and Supports: Install hangers and supports per MSS SP-69 selections appropriate for pipe size, material, and service conditions. Submit hanger schedule for approval showing MSS type, size, and location for each application.

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: The TAB report requirements are extraordinarily detailed with specific formatting requirements for dozens of data points. While comprehensive reporting is valuable, the specification micromanages report format to an impractical degree. Standard AABC or NEBB report formats should be acceptable without requiring customization to match this specification exactly.
findings.existingText: General Report Data:  In addition to form titles and entries, include the following data: [extensive list]...
findings.replacementText: General Report Data: Reports shall follow AABC or NEBB standard formats. Include all data necessary to document system performance and demonstrate compliance with design requirements.

findings.issue: Specification lists multiple products for adhesives, mastics, lagging adhesives, and sealants with very specific performance criteria. Many of these products are interchangeable for typical HVAC applications. The level of product specificity creates procurement constraints without meaningful performance benefit for standard duct insulation applications.
findings.existingText: Products:  Subject to compliance with requirements, provide one of the following: [specific product lists]
findings.replacementText: Products: Provide products by established manufacturers that comply with specified performance requirements. Submit product data for approval.
